review_full: Went there for dinner, without any prior reservation, we were immediately seated. The restaurant has a beautiful atmosphere, with nice background music, we got seated in the ground floor near the oven and the bar, I didn’t mind but I would recommend a table in the first floor, for maximum comfort. Started with the Baked potato with smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce, didn’t disappoint! The main was Lobster Ravioli, around 7 big pieces of black Ravioli filled with lobster, really liked it. For the dessert, I got Panna Cotta and I really recommend it as a dessert!  Overall, food was great, staff was friendly and price was okay, you get what you pay for. Approx 60 euros for two people.

There was an English menu available and the staff were very friendly and could speak great English if you need it. We picked a few dishes, all exceptional, but the stand out dish had to be the dumplings. Random, but brilliant.  There's so many choices in Madrid I suspect choosing a place to eat can be a little overwhelming (I was visiting a friend who lived in Madrid so didn't have this problem). However, if you head here you simply cannot go wrong!

title_review: Amazing tapas and paella - a must visit
review_preview: This place has got to be one the best tapas places in town and is a must on anyone's list. From the nice polite young man on the front door to every member of staff who served us this places oozes service.Although like most...
review_full: This place has got to be one the best tapas places in town and is a must on anyone's list. From the nice polite young man on the front door to every member of staff who served us this places oozes service. Although like most traditional tabernas this place is quite small by UK standards it doesn't let you down with the quality of the food. We had a mixture of tapas and paella (which was worth the wait in cooking time). Every dish we tried was well presented and hot. The fish mousse was very tasty and the octopus was quite a large portion. The ham croquettes were hot and tasty and the mixed paella (seafood, chicken and veg) was enough 2 people and a reasonable price also (20 euro's). I think the only thing we could pick at was the fact that for us the coffees let us down, unless you're a fan of small strong nesspresso coffees. Miss this and miss out!

review_preview: After doing a search on trip advisor for the best tapas we went to El minibar for dinner. A very small bar/restaurant with a big atmosphere and friendly welcome.  Our waiter was lovely and took the time to talk us through the menu. We orders...
review_full: After doing a search on trip advisor for the best tapas we went to El minibar for dinner. A very small bar/restaurant with a big atmosphere and friendly welcome. Our waiter was lovely and took the time to talk us through the menu. We orders 5 tapas and our waiter did advise us that 4 would be enough. We went ahead with 5 and have to agree 4 was plenty! We didn't have any cocktails but saw a lot of people with them and they looked good. One of the cheapest places for cocktails in Madrid. The food was amazing. I've eaten out at 5 tapas bars and this one was by far the best. It was unbelievably cheap for huge portions and high quality food. Wonderful chilled Italian house rosé at only 12 euro is a real bargain. Not up to a 100 euro for four was great value for such an exquisite evening in a beautiful setting with friendly staff. What a difference with the previous night at Botin restaurant ( oldest restaurant in the world ) where we almost paid double for canteen food . When looking for roman cuisine in Madrid : Oven Gran Via !

review_full: This was another great meal in Madrid. Choose this restaurant if you want a more formal setting for dinner. It is in the Hotel Mayorazgo, so there is no signage outside on the street. It is in the busy theater district of Madrid, not too far from the metro station. It was a business dinner with 8 persons. When I made the reservation I guess I chose a prix fix menu. The problem with the menu was that it was beef as the main course and not everyone was a meat eater in our group, but the manager was very helpful and allowed us to order fish and 6 out of 8 ordered the fish. So very nice of him to accommodate us. We had wine with dinner and again the manager selected a white and a red that were priced very well 15 and 19 EURO. The food was very well prepared and presented. The table setting was very formal. The service was excellent. I would highly recommend it.

review_full: Booked table for 2 via TripAdvisor online booking option. This was via The Fork which entitled us to a 20% discount on final bill. All very simple to use and table was waiting for us as promised. The restaurant is within a hotel just of the Grand Via. It is very cosy and has a good ambience. We immediately felt very comfortable. I ordered the Monkfish and my partner the fillet steak. For dessert I had the Creme pancake. But beforehand we were given complimentary breads and foie gras, butter and olive oil. All very tasty. We had the local bottle of Madrid blanco vino - 'Arate' which was only €11 but tasted better than the €30/40 bottles we had elsewhere  The dinner was excellent, dessert delicious. The staff were lovely, very friendly without being overbearing and made it a very pleasant experience  Best of all this fine dining evening came in at €56 euros (with discount) As a couple on a budget this was tremendous  Highly recommend a visit

review_preview: I stopped by Oven on a lark after a long day of errands. The prices were very reasonable but It definitely showed in the quality. I ordered a simple pasta dish with tomato, eggplant, and mozzarella. The tomato sauce was tasty enough but the eggplant...
review_full: I stopped by Oven on a lark after a long day of errands. The prices were very reasonable but It definitely showed in the quality.  I ordered a simple pasta dish with tomato, eggplant, and mozzarella. The tomato sauce was tasty enough but the eggplant pieces were small and hard to find. And the biggest disappointment was the mozzarella. Considering this is a “mozzarella bar” I was expecting some nice chunks of mozzarella, but I couldn’t see any cheese at all. I even asked the waiter if it was the correct dish and if there was mozzarella in it. He assured me there was but I never found any evidence of it. I tried to compensate by adding parmesan, but the stuff they had on the table was a kind of cheap, fake, sawdust parmesan, it wasn’t real cheese.  Service was friendly enough though I had to ask several times for the bill. All in all, it was a pretty disappointing experience. The food seemed to be an experiment by the ownwers in how to wring the most money out of their customers while offering the least acceptable food. I have an apartment nearby but won’t be back. I think they must survive off the tourist trade due to their location on Gran Via.

We didn't mind the extra walk and returned as requested and were promptly seated. The menu features all kinds of wonderful dishes, each can be ordered as Portion or Tapa. Ask the waiter to recommend you if you feel unsure about your choice...you won't be disappointed. Do try their signature melted goat cheese, it's absolutely wonderful....as is the tuna with guacamole, etc etc. We ordered two rounds of different dishes...wanted more but simply couldn't. Totally satisfied we've decided to go back another day to try the rest of the menu.  Service is friendly and swift, as mentioned in other reviews it could be more efficient (every single employee asks you if you're okay and if they can help you)....but it doesn't make it any less wonderful. Go there !

We were seated within a few minutes and were blown away by the service! Our waiter offered recommendations and even told us when our eyes were than our stomach and to not order as much. We were definitely loving everything on the menu. We settled for the tuna, goats cheese (omg I could eat this every day!), buffalo salad and cod & prawns. The serving sizes were fantastic and we still couldn't finish all the food. I loved everything about this place, the honest food the banter of the waiters even though our Spanish was sub par. I'm happy I went here on my first day and I've got an opportunity to go there again before we leave!

review_preview: This restaurant has great promise but isn't there yet. The decor, music, ambience are quit good but the execution of the menu falls off in ways that are easily rectified. We ordered the tavola tapas to share which was good across the board and nicely...
review_full: This restaurant has great promise but isn't there yet. The decor, music, ambience are quit good but the execution of the menu falls off in ways that are easily rectified. We ordered the tavola tapas to share which was good across the board and nicely presented. The bread was a poor choice however.  We followed that with two pasta dishes. I rarely if ever order pasta carbonara when not in Rome but I made an exception because it was touted on the menu as being 'authentic'. My partner ordered the pappardelle with 'pearls de trufa' and porcinni mushrooms. Carbonara is a classic dish with four key ingredients. Unfortunately one of the four was completely absent; there was no fresh cracked pepper to be seen anywhere on the plate. The guanciale was included but in large pieces instead of lardons. The dish was dry and coagulated into a lump shortly after it arrived at the table. The pappardelle was on the soupy side with too much cream and no noticeable taste of truffles. Some closer attention to details in the kitchen would be a huge improvement to an otherwise pleasant experience. The staff did a very good job. The crew in the kitchen needs to step up their game.

title_review: The Best Tapas, our best meal in Madrid
review_preview: We deliberately came here for lunch (with the high recommendation from Trip Advisor). Food: We ordered a Torreta De Huevos (Torreta Egg with sliced roasted potatoes), Bacalao (salt cods with prawns), 1/2 rabas (squid rings), a strawberries mojito, a toffee cheesecake and a bottle of...
review_full: We deliberately came here for lunch (with the high recommendation from Trip Advisor).  Food: We ordered a Torreta De Huevos (Torreta Egg with sliced roasted potatoes), Bacalao (salt cods with prawns), 1/2 rabas (squid rings), a strawberries mojito, a toffee cheesecake and a bottle of water.  The Torreta egg potatoes was the star of the day. It came in a pot with large portion. The egg yolks were still runny and lovely. The roasted potatoes were hot and crispy. The aubergine and parma ham added a bit of extra taste to the texture and it was a perfect dish. The Salt cods with prawns came in 4 pieces each and they were fantastic too. The butter coated cod were crispy outside and the fishes were very moist inside, they melt in my mouth and were not oily at all. The prawns were also fresh and delicious when dipped into the olive oil. The squid rings was supposed to be a tapas as it cost only 5 Euro, but the portion was surprisingly big. The squids were hot, meaty and crispy and it married so well with the freshness of the salad dressing. The strawberries mojito was another amazing cocktail as I never had mojito with strawberries before. Everything was outstanding and tasty. (I forgot to add that it came with sliced of breads and cheese canapé (on the house))  Service: The staffs were very friendly and helpful. The female staff explained to me patiently about each dish from the menu and she gave us good recommendations. She also warned me that I ordered too much initially. The rest of the staffs were also very kind and kept checking whether we were happy during our meal. The food were served fast to the table. The service was 5 stars.  Restaurant: El Mini Bar is a very low key restaurant which located at the basement. From the exterior, it's hard to tell that it is a restaurant. However, the interior design is lovely and cosy. It is a bit dark as it looks like a bar (which it is) rather than a restaurant, but I love it. I also like the portraits of celebrities and presidents on the wall. The seats and tables are comfortable too. I felt very relax and cheerful dinning there. Price: Bacalao (13), Torreta (9), Rabas (5), Mojito (7), Water (1.5), toffee cheesecake (4.5). A full belly lunch for two people cost less than 40 Euro (+ tips, which I gave a lot (10 euro) because I was extremely satisfied). It's been the cheapest meal we had in Madrid but its food quality and quantity were the best. In summary, the food quality here was great, it's cheap, and the service was flawless. The only slight downside was the restaurant at the basement, as some people would prefer to sit under the sunshine or outdoor. It's my best restaurant in Madrid and it was also the best Spanish meal I had in my life. It deserves a 10 stars rating if Trip Advisor allows me. 100% recommended! Wish I will return one day. It's perfect!

The food was just the right mix of adventurous but comforting. It is nice to be an appreciated guest and have delicious food. Highly recommend!

review_preview: Positives:Our server Sandra was so accommodating, friendly and attentive. The bread was good and plentiful. My husband loved the Cosmo. At the end of the meal they provided cookies and lilac flavored candy.Now the food Review: It wasn't good. We ordered the stew...
review_full: Positives: Our server Sandra was so accommodating, friendly and attentive. The bread was good and plentiful. My husband loved the Cosmo. At the end of the meal they provided cookies and lilac flavored candy. Now the food Review:  It wasn't good. We ordered the stew available on Weds and Fri evening which was billed as the specialty of the house and a tradition carried over from the founder of the restaurant. It came out as very dry meat (and body parts from various animals) on top of garbanzo beans with a boiled carrot and potato thrown in. I don't know which was grossest: the chunk of blood sausage, the chunk of completely well done dried out beef or the giant pig ear in the middle of the plate.  As I am writing this review, I am finding it hard to believe that A) I actually ate some of it and B) how utterly gross it was.  The other problem is the very limited menu selection. There were only 4 or 5 main entree choices and unfortunately I the chose the house specialty for the evening. Perhaps the other menu selections are better but I can only share my experience.

review_preview: As it was close to our hotel we went there for dinner- based on the very positive reviews on Tripadvisor. I have to say I would be amazed if there are not many more than 10 restaurants which are better than this in Madrid. The...
review_full: As it was close to our hotel we went there for dinner- based on the very positive reviews on Tripadvisor. I have to say I would be amazed if there are not many more than 10 restaurants which are better than this in Madrid. The waiting staff were generally keen but seemed vague and unsure what to do-and when to do it. They didn't speak English well (or at all) and took a very long time to take our drinks order- then ages to bring the drinks. The bread arrived with- out butter and we had to ask twice for it. The food (when it finally arrived) was average to good - but not great. No wine list ever appeared - apart from about half a dozen wines mentioned at the end of the food menu. With some difficulty I ordered a piccolo bottle of cava- that then disappeared never to be seen again -although there was still about 40% of the contents left. So, although we enjoyed our meal - this was hardly an A grade restaurant to appear in the same company as those with Michelin stars. If this is what you want suggest you go elsewhere.

title_review: Evening meal at Oven Gran Via, Madrid.
review_preview: This is my first experience of eating at an Oven restaurant, and the atmosphere was very pleasant, with music that was not too loud in the background, which complimented it.  There is quite a good choice available of main courses, pizza, pasta and salads, with...
review_full: This is my first experience of eating at an Oven restaurant, and the atmosphere was very pleasant, with music that was not too loud in the background, which complimented it. There is quite a good choice available of main courses, pizza, pasta and salads, with me choosing the pasta Horna, spicy (Tomato, mozzarella cheese, mushrooms, pepperoni and parmesan cheese) and served in the metal dish. When I placed my order the waitress Maura happily confirmed that I could have the same dish but without the peperoni. There was a nice selection of desserts, which I went for the Biscotti Al Horno (Baked chocolate with stracciatella ice cream and chocolate soup). I would recommend coming here, just wish I had more time on my trip to return.

review_preview: Inside the Best Western Mayorazgo Hotel in Madrid is this exquisite restaurant called Gastro Via 61. It's a gourmet upscale restaurant and they treat you like you are royalty. They start out giving you complimentary Pate that tastes like no other you have had and...
review_full: Inside the Best Western Mayorazgo Hotel in Madrid is this exquisite restaurant called Gastro Via 61. It's a gourmet upscale restaurant and they treat you like you are royalty. They start out giving you complimentary Pate that tastes like no other you have had and an assortment of breads, each one better than the previous. We also shared Sardines with Tomato Caviar which was the best ever. Then Sea Bass with homemade pasta and scallops in a light cream sauce and Hake with an anchovy cream with zucchini. Both were wonderful.  We were both so full that we couldn't order dessert but they brought us a delicious complimentary liquor. Wonderful experience! Definitely go there for dinner! The wait staff was so attentive and they speak English!!!

review_preview: After reading positive reviews and getting a bit tired of tapas after a few nights in Madrid, we decided to try this place. What a mistake! My starter was a dish of coagulated melted cheese, with a couple of skimpy slices of pepper on top,...
review_full: After reading positive reviews and getting a bit tired of tapas after a few nights in Madrid, we decided to try this place. What a mistake! My starter was a dish of coagulated melted cheese, with a couple of skimpy slices of pepper on top, not impressive. Unfortunately our waiter didn't have the best English and got our main course incorrect. As I'm a vegetarian I couldn't eat what we were given, even though I did feel sorry for him! So another waiter came to sort our order and I clarified our order, and made sure he understood that I was a vegetarian. About 20 minutes later our pizzas arrived, and mine was covered in anchovies! I called the waiter again and he apologised and took the pizza away, returning to the table less than a couple of minutes later with what was obviously the same pizza with the anchovies taken off! I just couldn't believe it and was not prepared to order a main course for the third time so we left the restaurant. My advice is to stick to the more traditional Spanish restaurants and don't bother with this place.

title_review: Tasty and not expensive.  Excellent service.
review_preview: It's only a five minutes walk from Puerta del Sol, in a small street. The restaurant itself is very cosy. We ate there twice - lunch and dinner. The service was friendly and very eficcient. Most of the dishes were very tasty. Those that were...
review_full: It's only a five minutes walk from Puerta del Sol, in a small street. The restaurant itself is very cosy. We ate there twice - lunch and dinner. The service was friendly and very eficcient. Most of the dishes were very tasty. Those that were very tasty were the patatas bravas with their exellent sauce, the humus tapa, the mango chatney tapa, the seafood paella, the octopus, the entrecote steak, the bacalao fish and the cheese cake desert. The dishes that were not tasty: chicken with mustard sauce, fried eggplant slices with sweet sauce, crumbles of fish and the rice with milk desert. the creme of caramel was so-so.

title_review: Rosi La Loca A Must when in Madrid
review_preview: Came here with the wife and kids looking for an awesome place to eat with our picky kids. Found the place on line, and wife saw the Burrata with Pesto and was “soooo, going there”. We didn’t have reservations and place was packed, but the...
review_full: Came here with the wife and kids looking for an awesome place to eat with our picky kids. Found the place on line, and wife saw the Burrata with Pesto and was “soooo, going there”. We didn’t have reservations and place was packed, but the host Alex gave us a table that they had set up for a party of 9, but wouldn’t be there for an hour. Plenty of time for us I mentioned to him. He sat us in the coolest pink flamingo room downstairs and we pretty much had a private “suite” to enjoy our meal. Our server was awesome and we even had a great conversation with Javi, the executive chef, about food and Madrid and other spots. He gave us some great recommendations of pastry shops for breakfast or snacks the next day, which we went to (Pasteleria Del Pozo and CasaMira for fresh made turrón). We had a blast. Not gonna say we won’t be coming back for a second time, that’s how awesome it was. A must in Madrid

The place preferred reservations but our family party of 4 went there at 6:30pm on a Friday evening and was told that if we could finish the food by 8pm because of no reservation made in advance, we could have a table right away...of course we settled. Ordered one each of the paella for two since we have 4 people in the party. One was seafood and the other was surf & turf paella! We received an appetizer of French fried with spicy sauce which was very good stomach teaser! Both paella’s were quickly consumed because they were very good. We finished the meal 1/2 hr before 8pm and were happy that we tasted paella as well as quite good food too!

title_review: Our favorite tapas bar so far in Madrid
review_preview: We were not planning to come here but since we had visited Mercado San Miguel and was not overly impressed (don't get me wrong it was nice and had good food but i have seen better) i was checking for a good place in the...
review_full: We were not planning to come here but since we had visited Mercado San Miguel and was not overly impressed (don't get me wrong it was nice and had good food but i have seen better) i was checking for a good place in the neighbourhood..and El Mini Bar came up. Read a couple of reviews and we headed there. The place was already full by 8pm so we were asked to wait for 20 mins which we did not mind. Actually we got the table before. El Minibar is small but lovely. Nice decor and atmosphere. Our experience was made special both by the food and by the waitress who was very helpful and had very good english. We tried several tapas..all delicious...but my favorite was their award winning dish...i could have eaten two on my own! The bill was one of the best we had in our stay...if not THE best. I highly recommend this place and will visit again for sure if i am back in Marid.

title_review: Excellent food. Great flavors. Fantastic Service.
review_preview: This restaurant met all of our criteria when dining out. Excellent food. Nice ambience. Attentive service. And fantastic value. We ordered two ceviches which were delicious. Two types of pizzas both perfect and delicious. Two bolognes pasta dishes which had perfect balance of meat to...
review_full: This restaurant met all of our criteria when dining out. Excellent food. Nice ambience. Attentive service. And fantastic value. We ordered two ceviches which were delicious. Two types of pizzas both perfect and delicious. Two bolognes pasta dishes which had perfect balance of meat to pasta and delicious flavors, pasta perfectly cooked. review_preview: We read about the place in TripAdvisor but were not committed to trying it.  However, we ended up just around the corner and decided to pop in.  We were so glad we did.All the food we saw looked delicious.  The dishes we ordered were...
review_full: We read about the place in TripAdvisor but were not committed to trying it. However, we ended up just around the corner and decided to pop in. We were so glad we did. All the food we saw looked delicious. The dishes we ordered were spectacular. We had the squid strips. The cornmeal crust was crispy and crunchy and not greasy. The squid was incredibly tender. It squid cane on a bed of salad with a light aioli sauce on it. A nice contrast of tender and crunchy, hot and cold. We moved onto the pankitos. They were like chicken tenders served in a paper cone and with three sauces. Like the squid they were juicy and hot encased in a crisp crunchy deep fried coating. The three sauces were lovely. We saved the grilled goat cheese for last as recommended by two young lads from Manchester. They were so right. The cheese was very smooth and melty. We could not get enough of the tomato jam. I am glad we reserved some of our table bread to soak up the yumminess. Manners prevented me from licking the plate clean. Although truth be told, if my family wasn't with me I would have.  We also ordered a bocadilla. Warm crusty bread cradling the fragrant and fatty Serrano ham. By itself it would have been satisfying. But suffering from comparison to the other dishes, it was merely delicious.  Oh and the mural of Freddie Mercury on the wall of the men's room was an added surprise. Thanks fellow reviewers. It was a good call.

Every recommendation given to me was a complete winner! Words cannot do justice to describe the sheer explosion of flavours of every dish. From the plain looking eggplant fries, to the orgasmic cheese-ball injected with pesto, everything was top notch. In the end, my eyes proved to be bigger than my belly, as I got a bit carried away when ordering.  The staff were warm & knowledgeable, and the whole experience has definitely been one of the highlights of my trip. Do yourself a favour, make s reservation & give this place a go: you won't regret it!

title_review: Rosi satisfies but its sister restaurant Inclan is fabulous
review_preview: We couldn't get into Rosi one evening but were taken round the corner to their new sister restaurant Inclan.   Very friendly staff, interesting decor with pages of books spread out like chandeliers but the absolute high point was a tomato.  Yes a tomato but not...
review_full: We couldn't get into Rosi one evening but were taken round the corner to their new sister restaurant Inclan. Very friendly staff, interesting decor with pages of books spread out like chandeliers but the absolute high point was a tomato. Yes a tomato but not like any tomato you've ever eaten. It was skinned , chilled and filled with a mozzarella and parmesan mousse-like filling. I never did discover how they had managed it as I couldn't find a chink in the tomato flesh. And it was sublime. We went to Rosi another evening but I definitely preferred Inclan. Well done guys!

review_preview: I found this place when searching Google and TA. It's right in the middle of a very touristy street where people try to lure you into their restaurant. As did David at this place. Only, we already knew we wanted to go here. David advised...
review_full: I found this place when searching Google and TA.  It's right in the middle of a very touristy street where people try to lure you into their restaurant.  As did David at this place. Only, we already knew we wanted to go here.  David advised us to at least try the stuffed pepper, a specialty in this city.  We were given a table downstairs, together with the other tourists.  Then came the most charming and uber-sweet Brasilian waitress. She later told us she worked here only since a week, but she worked very efficiently already. We totally loved her.  The food was very good. Not too much salt like in most places and well balanced in terms of herbs and spices.  The service was fast! And this waitress kept an eye on every table to make sure everyone was well catered for.  There are two things that made our evening. The food and the service.  Forget the facade and the first impression. This place is great.

review_preview: We were in Madrid for a long weekend and chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday. We chose very well.It is a smart restaurant, spacious and nicely decorated.We were presented with an amuse bouche of chicken pate served with crispy toast. For a...
review_full: We were in Madrid for a long weekend and chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday. We chose very well. It is a smart restaurant, spacious and nicely decorated. We were presented with an amuse bouche of chicken pate served with crispy toast.  For a starter my wife and I shared the tuna tartare. This was more than enough for two and really lovely.  For mains my wife had the cod and I had the sea bass on a skewer. This was presented and filleted by the waitress at the table. Both our mains were lovely, generous and beautifully presented. For dessert we shared the chocolate bomb. Lovely.  We both had coffees and were presented with a complimentary liqueur.  You are charged €2,50 for bead and €4 for a bottle of water, which I know niggles some people. I would say that a bottle of wine at this restaurant starts at just €10 which is amazing for a restaurant of this quality. We had a very nice dry white for just €14. Throughout the service was very, very good. For three courses, a bottle of wine and coffees we paid €103 which is extremely goid value for the setting, service and excellent quality of food. I would recommend this restaurant or a special occasion but equally you could have an excellent two course meal here any night for a very reasonable price.

Recommended.

review_preview: Stumbled upon this restaurant randomly and despite all the recommendations I had for places to eat in Madrid, this was by FAR the nicest. We had a cheese and meat board to share for starters which was fab. I had a pizza for main and...
review_full: Stumbled upon this restaurant randomly and despite all the recommendations I had for places to eat in Madrid, this was by FAR the nicest. We had a cheese and meat board to share for starters which was fab. I had a pizza for main and (I think) it was the nicest pizza I have ever had. I can't remember the name but it had honey and BBQ on it! My friend is a ceoliac and even though it was disappointing that there was only one option for her, her risotto was also delicious. I didn't intend on having dessert but my friends talked me into it and oh my days, we got the biscotti and I had to begrudgingly share it. It was absolutely superb. It reminded me of a "skillet cookie sundae" I had somewhere in Marbella as a child and had since never forgotten! The service was also excellent, which was a breath of fresh air given the issues we had had in other restaurants during our trip to Madrid unfortunately due to the language barrier. Highly recommend and really good value.

review_preview: When you have your first look into Gastrovia 61 you will think that the restaurant is really large. After a while you notice that it is only an illusion, due to walls covered with mirrors. As a matter of fact there are not very many...
review_full: When you have your first look into Gastrovia 61 you will think that the restaurant is really large. After a while you notice that it is only an illusion, due to walls covered with mirrors. As a matter of fact there are not very many tables available. With the menu, they also delivered a small ”dictionary”, which explained Spanish words and expressions used in the menu. Wonderful idea! (Hope they attach this also on their web-page.) After the kitchens´ greeting we shared a ”Villa of grilled white asparagus and “Corte” of octopus on nuts and tomatoes in vinaigrette”, which was very good. My main – ”Guadarrama grilled sirloin steak with slices of foie gras and “glaseás“ mini onions flavoured with berries” was delicious. Unfortunately my wife had suffered for a couple of days with stomach problems and was not able to enjoy much of her “Más chulo que un ocho“ beef tenderloin grilled over holm oak charcoal”. As dessert, my wife enjoyed “De Madrid al cielo“ Mont Blanc with chocolate, orange and Cointreau ice cream" which looked very exotic and was very good. I enjoyed a tasty ”Coffee bavarois with chocolate and crunchy “¡Barquillos de canela para el nene y la nena!” (wafers). Our evening had a surprising end, when the waiter brought the bill, he said that since my wife had eaten only a very small piece of her main dish they would not charge for it. Thank you, one more time!

review_full: My wife and I visited here for our final meal of this year's Spanish holiday and it was really lovely!  We'd seen details on Trip Adviser and it was very near to our present hotel, so....! The food was excellent, the surroundings very Spanish and the service friendly and extremely efficient. The menu was in English, but a separate sheet was also provided explaining some of the colloquial Spanish used in the Madrid area describing the food on the menu; a nice touch!  We enjoyed the experience sufficiently to investigate whether we could actually stay in the hotel next year, which we may well do!  My wife is disabled and uses a wheel chair. The hotel and restaurant are both fully accessible and the staff made no fuss whatsoever accommodating our needs! A really First Class experience. Muchas gracias!

title_review: Top-quality service at a very reasonable price
review_preview: I invited my parents for lunch for a special family occasion here a month ago on a Sunday. In short, this is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The staff was incredibly friendly and each and every one of them did...
review_full: I invited my parents for lunch for a special family occasion here a month ago on a Sunday. In short, this is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to.  The staff was incredibly friendly and each and every one of them did their utmost to make sure we had a good time and were completely satisfied. They carefully explained every dish and even had some interesting stories to tell about them. The place itself is also very well set-up. You might not like how it is set-up, I personally liked it very much but I recognize that the style could be seen as outdated for some. To me it added to the idea that this is a restaurant about Madrid.  The food was excellent. Portion sizes were just right, the dishes were all very well presented, and you could tell that there was abundant love and quality in all of them. All in all, don't think twice about it, this is perhaps the best restaurant in many aspects in Madrid, and definitely the one that gives you most bang for your buck.   Thank you to the restaurant and its staff for what they do!

review_preview: Found this place by pure luck, passing by after shopping and in need of a quick bite. When we entered, the place got my attention right away with its ultra trendy design, buzz and nice smell of food from the kitchen located at the side...
review_full: Found this place by pure luck, passing by after shopping and in need of a quick bite. When we entered, the place got my attention right away with its ultra trendy design, buzz and nice smell of food from the kitchen located at the side of the ground floor. We were greeted right away and shown to the table, explained all and got an english version of the menu. We chose the Burrata Iberica with a bit of bread, bottle of Tempranillo from Ribera del Duero, Prosciutto pizza and Burrata y Jamón Iberico pizza. Starter arrived quite fast and was already a great sign of a good choice. Full of flavour in great combination of cheese and jamon, bread still warm as brought fresh from the oven. We managed the starter in no time and moved onto the pizzas. As 38 years old pizza lover I have quite a few pizzas under my belt;))) and still this was something I would call the best pizza of my life (talking about the Burrata y Jamon iberico). Melted burrata together with warm jamon, melting on its top, together with couple of fresh basil leaves.. absolute treat.. After finishing the pizza, we ordered couple of desserts. Tiramisu and Biscotti al Forno. The later was the winner there, again full of flavours and an absolute delight, accompanying the well tasting coffee too. The place is very neatly made, nice decor, great lights, kitchen on display, toilets in a great design with nice idea of the deep sinks, plus very nice view at grand via. Service wise, fully staffed and easy to get attention of anyone when needed, needless to say that everyone was very friendly and polite with genuine smiles. I guess working in a place where you’re proud of what you’re serving makes a huge difference for both sides, the customer and staff. To summarise it, the bill was a great surprise as well as with water, bottle of wine, starter, 2 pizzas, 2 coffees, 2 desserts and bread came to €68.. With the quality of ingredients the value is definitely great and worth of visiting and coming back again and again!;) Thank you!!

review_full: This was one of the biggest disappointments we had on our trip. I don't understand how this place is so highly rated. The photos are very misleading. In person the place looks cheap, old and cheesy. The service was absolutely horrible. We were the only ones there and the waiter ignored us that night. He spent his time chatting on the phone. He even forgot one main dish, which at the end we were happy about because the place was so bad that all we wanted was to leave. The food was bland and not even served at the right temperature. I agree with a review that this place is a "wannabe" fine dining but it terribly fails. The execution of the dishes is simply bad. We should have paid attention to the signs: cheap, old and cheesy place, bad service from the start and a bad/bland appetizer. After the first appetizer we should have left. Lesson learned.

Definitely was my favorite place!

title_review: Friggin' Best Tapa I Had the Entire Trip
review_preview: We rolled in on Valentine's night without a reservation and it was a full house. Regardless, we were treated very well by the staff and the owner/manager that was there was SUPER nice and over the top friendly. We cozied up on the bar to...
review_full: We rolled in on Valentine's night without a reservation and it was a full house. Regardless, we were treated very well by the staff and the owner/manager that was there was SUPER nice and over the top friendly. We cozied up on the bar to get drinks and tapas while we waited for a table to open up. When we got our table the manager listened to both of our likes/dislikes and recommended some items. I'm SO HAPPY we went with the grilled goat cheese. I'm still craving this dish. My absolute fave. The tinto de verano (local's version of sangria) was in a massive cup and totally worth the money. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed yet has its own little flair of sophistication. This is the ONLY place we visited twice to get food/drinks at during our entire trip. Side note: I'm a fluent Spanish speaker but the staff seemed pretty comfortable in English.

review_preview: Found el minibar trough TripAdvisor with such a high rating in a beautiful and busy city with so many places to eat. It was quite full when we arrived and were seated on the first floor which wasn’t that cozy as the restaurant itself. We...
review_full: Found el minibar trough TripAdvisor with such a high rating in a beautiful and busy city with so many places to eat. It was quite full when we arrived and were seated on the first floor which wasn’t that cozy as the restaurant itself. We asked straight away if there was a free table downstairs we could get it. After a couple of minutes they transferred us downstairs. The prices are really nice, and the goat cheese is a recommended highly by us. They made it with crystallized sugar on top which made a crispy layer all over the plate, and tomato jam to complete the dish. Several courses (just a lot of food) and a bottle of wine under 60€ for the two of us. Money well spent. If we have the chance we would come back for sure and would recommend the restaurant. Keep it up el minibar

We had their grilled goat cheese tapa which was one of the best things we ate in Madrid. We also had the chicken pankitas which were like chicken tempura with three tasty dipping sauces. As good as the food was,probably the best thing was the service with a smile. These guys truly go out of their way to make your visit special. I also saw many drinks being made and enjoyed(A little early for us). Still thinking about that goat cheese even though we are back in the states!

review_preview: Having saved el minibar as one of my must try places to try tapas in madrid, I quickly checked into my hotel and headed straight here to satisfy the travel hunger.On arrival we recieved a lovely greeting and once I quickly used up my...
review_full: Having saved el minibar as one of my must try places to try tapas in madrid, I quickly checked into my hotel and headed straight here to satisfy the travel hunger. On arrival we recieved a lovely greeting and once I quickly used up my total Spanish vocabulary in around 1 minute which we all had a laugh at we got a table near the bar. There is some lovely art around the place and the general vibe in the place is relaxed and enjoyable. We ordered some sangria each which was delicious and is up there with the best ive tried of the mini tour of Spain I am currently on. We were also given some aperitifs while we browsed the menu which were very tasty. Toastado with salmon. Our waiter gave us an english menu (gracias!) and proceeded to make some recommendations of their popular dishes. We had the wild boar which comes wrapped in a thin pastry and topped with a creamy mushroom sauce over about half of it which was perfect as the pastry stayed crisp and was not too rich. We also had the calamari, steak slices and a main course of what I think was battered cod sliced into 4 with a large prawn on each piece of cod lying in a bed of garlic sauce. We were brought some bread which was perfect for mopping up the plates and washed it all down with another glass of the delicious sangria. I think the bill (without tip) came to around 42euros. Good value for delicious tapas. Will return here when next in Madrid.

Then each of us selected different TAPAS/Raciones, He talked us into a marvelous one with Spanish cheese which the restaurant had won some type of award. Every thing was delicious. We shared desert with our spouses. It was a wonderful meal and true learning experience. This is my favorite place in Madrid, because of the service, and caring attitude of our waiter and the entire restaurant staff. The amateurs we were, we never felt better taken care of--than here. God bless-El Mini Bar.

review_preview: It is not easy to find but well worth the effort. Tucked away on a side street off of Calle Mayor it is easy to pass by. My wife and I went for lunch and felt comfortable as soon as we entered. The restuarant inside...
review_full: It is not easy to find but well worth the effort. Tucked away on a side street off of Calle Mayor it is easy to pass by. My wife and I went for lunch and felt comfortable as soon as we entered. The restuarant inside is below street level but it is a unique and welcoming atmosphere. We went to many restaurants on our trip to Spain but we really felt that they went out of there way to make us feel comfortable which was not always the case with all the places we ate. Seating is limited but tables are spread out giving us plenty of privacy. Their tapas menu had many unique offerings. We had their specialty-grilled goat cheese and also pankitas(chicken tempura). I should also mention they brought us an appetizer before our order with no charge! These guys aim to please. My wife and I felt they were as good as any tapas on our 10 day trip. Can't see how anyone could find a better place for a casual lunch or dinner. Wish we had a place like this in the states. '

review_preview: We came to the restaurant without reservations and we were found a place to have dinner with a big smile by the owner Nacho who was most charming, helpful, and cheerful. He truly wanted all his customers to have a good meal, a good time,...
review_full: We came to the restaurant without reservations and we were found a place to have dinner with a big smile by the owner Nacho who was most charming, helpful, and cheerful. He truly wanted all his customers to have a good meal, a good time, and enjoy themselves. He stoped multiple times to our table to make sure that we were well taken care of. It’s also important to say that the place was packed and we went as the Spaniards do to have dinner late at night after 10 PM.The tapas were not only large and fairly priced but excellent. There are many daily specials and I strongly recommend that you follow their advice and eat their best dishes as they come out. Even though we think of tapas as small dishes here they’re quite large and a meal by themselves. Our daughter is a vegan and they made every effort to make her feel welcomed and attended. We had a wonderful experience and I would not hesitate to come back again. Great Job Nacho!!!!!

title_review: Very nice lunch - all fresh made
review_preview: We went here for lunch at 12:30 and were the first clients.Nice (a bit crazy decorated...) location and very friendly people.We had a few tapas all fresh made and they were delicious - all of them!After a short while this place was...
review_full: We went here for lunch at 12:30 and were the first clients. Nice (a bit crazy decorated...) location and very friendly people. We had a few tapas all fresh made and they were delicious - all of them! After a short while this place was packed with people and outside a long waiting queue. Don't panic and finish early because of that - this happens almost every day...!  This is not only a cool location with nice and friendly people but the food is really good and you get a lot of value for the prize you pay. Much more than in many other places in Madrid!!  For us this location was one of the best lunch-/dinner places in Madrid's centre. If we come back to Madrid we will come back to this place - for sure.   Rosi la loca team - you rock! Thanks for this wonderful moment today!

review_preview: Don’t be fooled by the floral exterior. This place is truly a tourist trap. On the day of the visit, the restaurant was full of tourists with no locals (never a good sign). The restaurant is situated in a dingy street, full of cigarette smoke...
review_full: Don’t be fooled by the floral exterior. This place is truly a tourist trap. On the day of the visit, the restaurant was full of tourists with no locals (never a good sign). The restaurant is situated in a dingy street, full of cigarette smoke that was drifting into the restaurant (very unpleasant). We had two tapas - given egg plant was one of their recommended, it was just greasy with no flavour. We ordered seafood paella and after an hour of an wait, we just left the restaurant. The table next door who ordered good 10 minutes after us got their paella before us. They must have mixed up the order. When I pointed this out to the waiter, all I got was a blank ‘it will be a couple more minutes’ without any apologies. Left feeling hungry, disappointed and tired.

title_review: Great meal upon Arrival in Madrid
review_preview: On our arrival in Madrid - and after a long morning of travel from Barcelona - we were more than pleased to find Oven Gran Via for our lunch selection. Great atmosphere, clean and well served by its staff. Even though we speak little/no Spanish,...
review_full: On our arrival in Madrid - and after a long morning of travel from Barcelona - we were more than pleased to find Oven Gran Via for our lunch selection. Great atmosphere, clean and well served by its staff. Even though we speak little/no Spanish, we were treated pleasantly, enjoying all the offerings for lunch. The pizza is simply made, and delicious. Cheese selections fresh and tasty, of course wine selections are varied and well priced. Enjoyed watching the large centrally located pizza oven, and how the staff quickly turned our orders into a delicious reality. Staff quickly seated and took orders from the bust mid- afternoon crowd - a mix of travelers, local business folks, and families stopping for a bite. Would absolutely return to eat at Oven Gran Via.

title_review: Best smoked salmon (smoked on the premises) in Madrid
review_preview: This is a beautiful little restaurant with some wonderful dishes at very reasonable prices, located near the corner of Calle de Atocha and Costilla de los Desamparados, just minutes away from the Prado and the Reina Sofia museums.I have been here a few times...
review_full: This is a beautiful little restaurant with some wonderful dishes at very reasonable prices, located near the corner of Calle de Atocha and Costilla de los Desamparados, just minutes away from the Prado and the Reina Sofia museums. I have been here a few times and have never been disappointed, and especially recommend the smoked salmon with Camembert cream and dill on toast - I have never tasted better smoked salmon despite having lived in the Scottish Borders for some 4 years. Lucas the chef is excellent in all departments and the staff are friendly and helpful. Well worth one, or more, visits. As a p.s. even the toilet is beautiful!

review_preview: We chose this restaurant based on the reviews of trip advisors. We love great food experience so we wanted a less touristic spot near the Gran Via. We were not disappointed at all. The place is small but finely decorated. Attention to detail is remarkable....
review_full: We chose this restaurant based on the reviews of trip advisors. We love great food experience so we wanted a less touristic spot near the Gran Via. We were not disappointed at all. The place is small but finely decorated. Attention to detail is remarkable. Personal is very welcoming and helpful in case you require assistance in your choice. Menu also available in English. Great selection of wines with a specific attention to Spanish ones. There was also a specific section dedicated to the region of Madrid only. Food was just amazing. Presentation, combination of ingredients, quantity, taste. We went for a starter, plate and desert and were really full in the end. Price is correct for such a restaurant in the middle of an important European capital. We will definitely come back.

review_preview: The reviews were excellent so perhaps our expectations were raised too high. We sat down after an enjoyable morning looking at art and decided that Italian food was preferable after many days of Spanish meals.The mixed platter was fabulous but it was the pizza...
review_full: The reviews were excellent so perhaps our expectations were raised too high. We sat down after an enjoyable morning looking at art and decided that Italian food was preferable after many days of Spanish meals. The mixed platter was fabulous but it was the pizza that let the restaurant down. The toppings looked great on paper, the pasta tasty. Unfortunately, neither quite lived up to our hopes. The pizza toppings were a bit too sloppy and could be better seasoned. The pasta dishes were just a little on the heavy side. Nonetheless, the restaurant was very comfortable and relaxed, the service was efficient and friendly, it was well staffed and the bill contained no surprises. A really good meal, but not excellent.

review_preview: After wining and dining very well throughout Spain on our month long vacation throughout Spain we spent our final evening at the GastroVía 61 restaurant where we were seated in a lovely dining room of gold, black and mirrors. We had arrived early at 8:30,...
review_full: After wining and dining very well throughout Spain on our month long vacation throughout Spain we spent our final evening at the GastroVía 61 restaurant where we were seated in a lovely dining room of gold, black and mirrors. We had arrived early at 8:30, by Spanish standards, and were lucky to receive the full attention of the staff. In addition to the bread we had two gratis amuse bouche before starting with a starter of 3 types of croquettes( 6 in all) and a flavourful pasta starter. Our mains were the veal loin in a teriacki sauce with mushrooms and a fabulous calf’s tail dish. The maître d’ was very friendly and gave us an excellent wine pairing for our meal. He also gave us a list of Spanish foodie words to take home.  We finished our meal with complimentary chocolates and a delicious digestive. The service provided was of a high standard. There is a sense that the staff all have pride in their restaurant and want their clients to enjoy their time there.

review_preview: We arrived in Madrid on Sunday and didn’t feel like venturing to far for our first night.  We stayed at the Hyatt Calle Gran Via so searched for restaurants we could take a walk too.  Before dinner we found a place for a beverage, Royale,...
review_full: We arrived in Madrid on Sunday and didn’t feel like venturing to far for our first night. We stayed at the Hyatt Calle Gran Via so searched for restaurants we could take a walk too. Before dinner we found a place for a beverage, Royale, then continued on to the restaurant located in the Hotel Mayorazgo. The restaurant is the GastroVia61. From the moment we sat down to the moment we left, it could not have been made better. They think of everything. The passed bread basket, the after dinner digestive, the complimentary croquettes. We had a few small plates: octopus, ceviche, gazpacho, and shared the steak tartare. And before I forget let me comment o. How reasonable the wines by the bottle are. We had a bottle of Verdejo. Now back to the food. Everything was the perfect size for sharing, it was delicious and the steak tartare was prepared tableside. And because we made our reservation through the Fork, we had 30% off our food bill. If you find yourself in Madrid, and enjoy food based on the culture where you are, please please go see the staff at GastroVia61, you will not be disappointed. PS we did not save room for dessert but before we head home we will go back to try the Sphere!

title_review: One of the worst restaurant experiences I’ve ever had
review_preview: We went last year with some friends to celebrate my birthday, from a recommendation from a friend who said that it was “looking to get a Michelin Star”. It was literally the worst restaurant experience I’ve ever had. I don’t think it’s fair to only...
review_full: We went last year with some friends to celebrate my birthday, from a recommendation from a friend who said that it was “looking to get a Michelin Star”. It was literally the worst restaurant experience I’ve ever had.  I don’t think it’s fair to only bag places for the stuff they do wrong so I’ll start with the positives- the presentation of the food was very creative, like “master chef” and presented in a Michelin Star way (ie explaining each dish, the ideas behind it and how to eat it etx). The restaurant was clean.  Now for the rest. We were a party of four people and on the menu we were offered two options. The long menu and the short menu. The same food in both and one with a couple of extra dishes. Turns out one of the people with us doesn’t eat seafood. And quite a few dishes in the menu contained seafood. The staff refused to change any of the dishes or offer any alternative. It was explained that she wasn’t “obliged” to eat anything but the menu was offered to a full table, ie she could have not ordered anything otherwise. So the only three options available were: all of us leave without eating (this option meant paying a large amount anyway, as a “depósit”), for the three of us to eat and for her to watch and maybe eat something later, or for all of us to order the full menu and for her to just leave the dishes without eating them. So we ended up ordering menus for everyone.  The first “dish” was a “caldo” that was very good. It had an Asian type flavour and was well presented and elaborated.  The rest of the dishes were very well presented (as I’ve mentioned above) and mostly were inedible. We tried different dishes (like tendons) which were very creative and not pleasant to eat at all. I’m not a fussy eater at all (I’ve eaten insects, live prawns, etc) and many of the dishes we couldn’t finish, despite being hungry. Our friend who didn’t eat seafood could only eat certain dishes anyway and even those weren’t edible. So of the whole menu, there were dishes that were unedible and those which were edible and not good. For the whole meal we were trying to look for positive things to say about the food (i support and respect creative cuisine) and couldn’t. The waitress asked us for our opinion of each different dish and it was obvious (by us not finishing the food) that we weren’t impressed by the dishes. She seemed surprised and insinuated that we were in the wrong because their dishes were amazing (according to her). At the end of the meal we set to pay (the restaurant is very expensive, especially considering our experience) and we expressed our deception between our expectations of how the experience would be and how it was. We were then insulted by the chef, the waitress and told basically that we were wrong and didn’t appreciate their food and that we had the option to leave at any time (after paying the “deposit” for the reservation anyway).  The end of the experience was that We paid a large bill for really bad food and obnoxious service. With so many amazing restaurants in Madrid I would suggest that people spend their money in other restaurants.  Literally the worst dining experience I’ve ever had

title_review: It's not hype if it's true!
review_preview: We spend weeks a year in Madrid and have been doing so for almost 10 years, and our dinner at Enklima was the best meal I have ever eaten in this city filled with wonderful restaurants.  Michelin star quality at (comparatively) reasonable prices - it...
review_full: We spend weeks a year in Madrid and have been doing so for almost 10 years, and our dinner at Enklima was the best meal I have ever eaten in this city filled with wonderful restaurants. Michelin star quality at (comparatively) reasonable prices - it simply stands in a class by itself. Portions were appropriately small given the number of courses, but each one was large enough so that one could truly savor the multiple subtle flavors that complement each other in every offering. Similarly, the wine list was fun and reasonable. Our new favorite (special occasion) restaurant in Madrid!

title_review: Modern South American place of great ambiance
review_preview: An eye-opener for anyone unfamiliar with South American cooking apart from Mexican.We particularly enjoyed arepas (any style) and the grilled octopus was amazing. The deserts were sublime, especially the “tres leches” cake. My husband, normally no fan of deserts, couldn’t stop eating it.For...
review_full: An eye-opener for anyone unfamiliar with South American cooking apart from Mexican. We particularly enjoyed arepas (any style) and the grilled octopus was amazing.  The deserts were sublime, especially the “tres leches” cake. My husband, normally no fan of deserts, couldn’t stop eating it. For lunch you get a great menu del dia priced well below what one would expect for the food of this quality and gastronomical imagination.  The service we received was very warm and friendly and we could tell that anyone stopping by for a cup of coffee would be returning to Cacao is a regular.  In the busy lunch time the place was not packed which though perhaps not being great for the owners was a great relief for us and our two kids.  I believe anyone would enjoy a trip to Cacao and will remember it for a long time.

review_preview: Seated promptly then totally ignored! After we decided on our selections, we realized no one had come for a drink order--it must have been at least 5 minutes, possibly more. We set a time limit and decided that if we were ignored for ten full...
review_full: Seated promptly then totally ignored! After we decided on our selections, we realized no one had come for a drink order--it must have been at least 5 minutes, possibly more. We set a time limit and decided that if we were ignored for ten full minutes more, we would leave. After another 9 minutes and 50 seconds ( no joke, we had actually started to push back) a waiter came. "Order?" (He knew no English), so we tried it out. My wife's order was available, but my selection was not available--"All finished" (Ok, he knew three words). I settled for a Gorgonzola Pizza. My wife's wine was poured at the table but no taste-to-approve was offered (a first for this trip to Spain!). Also no bread, no olives, nothing to raise the bar above take-out pizza. My wife's lobster ravioli had a distinct fishy/salty flavor but was not recognizable as lobster. The Gorgonzola pizza needed salt to bring out the flavor (think about that for a second to fully understand). All in all the worst dining experience in Spain in a very long time. No less expensive than some other very great meals with real quality service.

review_preview: I loved El miniBAR, so much so that I went back the next evening. Service was friendly and the food came promptly.The beer was delicious and cold, a welcome sight after walking around Madrid all day.Over the two visits I had -Beef...
review_full: I loved El miniBAR, so much so that I went back the next evening. Service was friendly and the food came promptly. The beer was delicious and cold, a welcome sight after walking around Madrid all day. Over the two visits I had - Beef burritos, a bargain at 2.50 each and easily my favourite. A close second we’re the Pankitos, delicious chicken strips with 3 dips at 5.00 for tapa. The variety of croquettes were a good choice also.  Crispy boar rolls with portabello mushroom sauce and Chicken Breast cubes with spicy cheese were ok, but I wouldn’t choose them again. Just a note for any Brit, the Scrambled Eggs with Serrano Ham and Pepper are actually fried eggs on a bed of thin cut fried sliced potatoes, with ham on top. And a large chilli pepper (9.00) It looks very impressive but I’d much rather have had more burritos.

review_full: Visited here with my boyfriend after searching for the best tapas bars in Madrid. We picked this one because of the one € sign.  We luckily managed to walk in and get a table straight away. But it was still really busy at nine so I’d say booking is probably better to do.  What an adorable place, lovely ambience and friendly staff. The cocktails were delicious.  We ordered five dishes and tried to order the six. The waitress was very kind and told us we probably wouldn’t need more than five dishes and also recommended the best food. Really helpful!  Wow wow the food was amazing and I could not believe how cheap it was compared to other places we have been. The melted cheese, with pesto and tomato jam was to die for. The aubergine wrapped in bacon, tomato and feta sauce was also delicious! Both dishes I had never tried before.  If you are visiting Madrid and seek food tapas, you definitely need to come here!

title_review: Cuban food almost as good as mine!
review_preview: We stumbled upon Borax when exploring the Chueca district.  We came back for dinner the next day and we were not disappointed.  The restaurant is small beautifully decorated and very peaceful in the hustle and bustle of Madrid.  The food was excellent!  We all had...
review_full: We stumbled upon Borax when exploring the Chueca district. We came back for dinner the next day and we were not disappointed. The restaurant is small beautifully decorated and very peaceful in the hustle and bustle of Madrid. The food was excellent! We all had ropa vieja and it was almost as good as mine!! The plantains, yucca and black beans were fabulous. The service was great. They were friendly and delightful! We were exchanging recipes. I wish I had a place like this close to my home. Go and try it out...a little taste of Cuba-

review_preview: So they are famous and you have to stand in a line outside the place waiting for your turn to arrive. When you get to the bouncer, he tries to be funny while waiting, and asks questions... to entertain you? Really, I don´t want to...
review_full: So they are famous and you have to stand in a line outside the place waiting for your turn to arrive. When you get to the bouncer, he tries to be funny while waiting, and asks questions... to entertain you? Really, I don´t want to be asked where I am from or why I am in Madrid.  The magic moment arrives that you are allowed to get into the place - and get rid of the bouncer and his questions. Ok, drinks are excellent, presentation is beautiful, water is also served with snacks that are often refilled.  In the beginning, there is A LOT of noise; music is loud and people have to scream to each other to be heard. Suddenly they turn up the music volume and from that moment on, it becomes impossible to have a conversation with the people you are with. So you end up looking at what is going on around or your cellphone. There is not a fixed style of music, so it goes from the typical music you hear at street festivals to some old songs.  I expected much more of this " famous " place. At least, I expected to have the possibility to talk with the ones I was with without being bombarded with tasteless music at full blast. All is all, for what I got, it was very expensive.

title_review: Best Spanish food I have eaten, reasonable price
review_preview: Have eaten Spanish food in Asia and in Europe, this is the best place to eat this type of cuisine. Ate dinner here twice as the food quality is good. Coupled with the decent price, this makes this restaurant an excellent value for tapas ,...
review_full: Have eaten Spanish food in Asia and in Europe, this is the best place to eat this type of cuisine.  Ate dinner here twice as the food quality is good. Coupled with the decent price, this makes this restaurant an excellent value for tapas , sangria and paella .  Do go for the paella as it is filling for 2 people . Once you eat it, there is no space for tapas hence we came back the second time to go for the tapas which were just as good as the paella . Do go for the traditional tapas and paella and you will enjoy them. The sangria is also very potent and not watered down like in many establishments. Around 10-15 € per person to have a decent, yummy and filling meal.

I think this is a very good place where eating spanish dishes in a typical atmosphere.

From the gazpacho, to the Tuna Tataki w/ sea salt and sesame seeds and the soft cheese and the paella, the food was exceptionally fresh and high quality. Thanks for everything, Eli. you were wonderful!!!

review_preview: Continuing our journey visiting some of the world's best bars we hit Madrid and sorry to say this was a slight bit disappointing after a day in Barcelona.The cocktails here are all gimmicky, lots of Flair's and jazz hands... The drinks themselves we're not...
review_full: Continuing our journey visiting some of the world's best bars we hit Madrid and sorry to say this was a slight bit disappointing after a day in Barcelona. The cocktails here are all gimmicky, lots of Flair's and jazz hands... The drinks themselves we're not so good as other bars we've visited recently. Though there selection of liquor is tremendous!! The bartender did seem knowledgeable, though when creating a special cocktail just for me he bitterly disappointed. I'm a whisky drinker, with a sweet tooth, I love cream liqueur and rich fruit flavours. The cocktail offered could only be described as a variant of a Negroni, though more bitter and dry with an unpleasant saltiness. Martini lovers would likely lap it up but it just put me off for the evening, and I finished drinking wine. First we decided to go to 5 Guys, however, the line was literally out the door. We walked through the narrow streets and came across Burnout. There happened to be a table available in this small restaurant.  I'm so happy we found this place! The burgers were delicious, the fries were crispy, the beer was refreshing, and the portion was perfect! Our party of four people all ordered different burgers and each person said their burger was delicious.  If you need a little break from tortilla española, or just you're just craving a burger, this place is excellent!

review_full: Just solid burgers served here. The restaurant is very close to Gran Via, so we were surprised that such good burgers were served there but it wasn't absolutely packed.  We went here 3 times, tried 3 different burgers (chili, chimole and burnout) which were all excellent. Also tried a chicken/bacon salad which was also good. Only thing that we didn't like was my mates edamame/avocado salad. That was little too plain for a main dish. All in all, if you go here for a burger, you get excellent value, especially if you take the lunch menu. The service is also friendly and the staff do speak some english. If you are near Gran Via and looking for a good price/quality ratio, this is your place. As said, with the amount of people on Gran Via there should be a queue outside for this joint.

review_preview: A bartender in Madrid had mentioned that Salmon Guru was a great bar and that on my next trip to Madrid I should try to go there. As it happens, David, who embodies what a bartender should be by anticipating what a client wants, now...
review_full: A bartender in Madrid had mentioned that Salmon Guru was a great bar and that on my next trip to Madrid I should try to go there. As it happens, David, who embodies what a bartender should be by anticipating what a client wants, now works there. I waited in line to go in for about 15 minutes (Madrid is very respectful and strict about complying with fire codes and the maximum persons allowed inside a restaurant or bar) and it was worth it! The service is exceptional (thank you, David, you are the best!!!), the bartenders work hard (I can attest to how hard David and Filippo, another bartender, worked), and the drinks were creative, beautiful works of art and simply delicious! The support staff, like Estefanía, who brought the bill, and another David, who was attentive about providing water and good potato chips to customers, couldn’t have been nicer. And, last but not least, I was truly surprised at the prices. Such drinks would cost a lot more in New York, Washington, D.C. and San Francisco. And they wouldn’t have been as beautiful!

title_review: Stand out bar in madrid  - Amazing Cocktails, food, music, decor!
review_preview: I love going to bars in Madrid where they are so attentive from the moment you walk in the door! This place is awesome - classic meets modern meets superhero meets Asia meets fish - right in the centre of Madrid. Absolutely stunning and delicious...
review_full: I love going to bars in Madrid where they are so attentive from the moment you walk in the door! This place is awesome - classic meets modern meets superhero meets Asia meets fish - right in the centre of Madrid. Absolutely stunning and delicious cocktails (a very extensive menu ranging from classics to newer inventions), there is plenty of seating amongst superhero-grafittied mirrors and neon lit ceilings, and you can drink until the wee hours of the morning. It's one of those places where each tune that comes on is a classic that you haven't heard in a while. Oh, and the food is fabulous too - lots of inventive dishes to share - definitely try the octopus! Nothing is too much for the staff - they'll they try and find the exact cocktail that you'll love. An absolutely must visit when you come to Madrid - make sure it's on the list!

We ordered our burgers cooked medium, but they were bright red on the inside, and the ground beef lacked consistency and crumbled all over our plates. title_review: Best experience in Madrid! Love this place.
review_preview: Where to start ... my husband and I seek out craft cocktail bars wherever we go. This goes down as one of our all time favorites. The drinks are creative and simply outstanding. The presentation incredible. I mentioned that my favorite drink was an old...
review_full: Where to start ... my husband and I seek out craft cocktail bars wherever we go. This goes down as one of our all time favorites. The drinks are creative and simply outstanding. The presentation incredible. I mentioned that my favorite drink was an old fashioned and the bartender whipped up a custom variation that was delicious. One of the best I've ever had. Apparently it won some award. I'm not surprised. Salmon Guru has everything a craft cocktail bar should have but the reason it will top our list is because the people who work there love their jobs. They are friendly, no pretentious attitudes that you can find at craft cocktail bars from time to time. If you are into cocktails, I encourage you to strike up a conversation with the staff. Adrian (the owner I think) spent so much time with us talking about his vision. It was a truly unique experience and we are better for having met such wonderful people and talented cocktail artisans. This will be on our must do list every time we visit Madrid.

In addition, they didn't let us wait outside, where it was a bit cold, but they let in a waiting room. The cocktail menu is more than a menu; it's a book with suggestions. The atmosphere is surreal and the cocktails are very creative and tasty. Chips are of high quality and not the cheap ones that you usually receive with your cocktail. Prices are fair. The only thing I didn't like is the waiting for the cocktails. I appreciated the wide selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.

He inhaled it in about 30 seconds, so thumbs up. I have burger with guacamole, crunchy onions and aiole mayo ( very good). Guinness chocolate cake is unbelievable.  If you have msg concerns, be careful. I usually don’t worry about it when in Europe, so I was taking my surprise when I had a reaction. I am not sure what triggered it ( guessing mayo, dressing, or crunchy onions) I would go there again and perhaps order a different burger to avoid msg.

review_preview: I am a neighbour of Borax and live on the next street up.  I've walked by it on so many occasions and never gone in (either in this or in any of its previous incarnations), so one Saturday when one of the workers asked me...
review_full: I am a neighbour of Borax and live on the next street up. I've walked by it on so many occasions and never gone in (either in this or in any of its previous incarnations), so one Saturday when one of the workers asked me in to try "delicious Cuban food", I decided to take him up on his offer.  The food was delicious. I got a fish dish which came with rice, black beans or frijoles and two other "extras". My experience of Cuban food is that it is quite heavy and carb-laden, and this was too. I tried my best to finish it off but it was a challenge, And that's when the word Tiramisú came up. I didn't think Tiramisú was particularly Cuban BUT, the waiter insisted that it was the best Tiramisú I'd try anywhere.  He wasn't lying. It was just amazing. Even for somebody who was already completely stuffed.  I haven't been back since because I will only be able to go on a day when I am absolutely ravenous. It's too much food for a "normal" day.

review_preview: Last time I was in Madrid I tried Borax and I was pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious -- I had the classic chicken steak with black beans and rice (bistec de pollo con arroz y frijoles negros). It was deliciously prepared with a hint...
review_full: Last time I was in Madrid I tried Borax and I was pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious -- I had the classic chicken steak with black beans and rice (bistec de pollo con arroz y frijoles negros). It was deliciously prepared with a hint of garlic and the beans were amazing. It was so good I went back another time and had it again with the fried tostones instead of rice. The second time was on a Saturday night and the place was packed and the only spot available was at the bar. I had so much fun talking with Julian as he mixed drinks for the other patrons. The mojitos were a big favorite. My friend sitting next to me tried the empanadas de carne and said they were the best he ever had. I had so much fun with the waiters and met the gracious owners Julian and Ariel. Definitely try Borax if you're in Madrid. I'll be going back for sure.

review_preview: I was looking for a great spot to celebrate my birthday and I found it ! Just a few days before the World Best Bars list was revealed and it is on the #47 and now I know why ! Entrance/Access:The Security Staff at...
review_full: I was looking for a great spot to celebrate my birthday and I found it !  Just a few days before the World Best Bars list was revealed and it is on the #47 and now I know why !  Entrance/Access: The Security Staff at the door was very friendly , and usually they are arrogant or sometimes rude , so that was a very good 1st impression .  The place :  I loved the decoration and the vibe like hipster and funky place to have a good cocktail and a snack .  It is not a big place so it could be crowded most of the time .  Drinks and Food : There’s a huge list of cocktails very creative and for everyone, even without alcohol , we took 15minutes to choose one.  The menu it’s very cool , and the presentation of the cocktails are the best !  The food is good but not outstanding.  Service: Very good if we consider that is in Spain because usually the service is bad and the waiters are unfriendly it seems like they don’t care , so very good for Estefanía ( she also recommended good drinks )  We also had a glass of water when we arrive to the table , nice detail !  Conclusion: From my perspective who I been working some years in the hospitality business I could say that..  It’s a very cool place with awesome cocktails, good service and good vibe . Is not cheap , but it worth it ! Could be great for an special occasion  It’s one of the best bars in the world ! Congratulations  Highly recommend it ...
