title_review: AMAZING cocktails in a wonderful atmosphere!!
review_preview: Salmon Guru was absolutely fantastic!! From the moment we walked into the dimly lit, stylishly decorated dining area, our evening was enjoyable and full of life. We had a group of 10 people, and were able to get two tables by the bar, which came...
review_full: Salmon Guru was absolutely fantastic!! From the moment we walked into the dimly lit, stylishly decorated dining area, our evening was enjoyable and full of life. We had a group of 10 people, and were able to get two tables by the bar, which came with wonderful service and a beautiful view of the place. The decor was on point, and the cocktail menu had something for every taste bud. I had the Yellow Chili, which was a spicy drink, and was amazed with how delicious my order was. While I am typically not a cocktail drinker, it was wonderful to treat myself to a perfectly balanced, well mixed cocktail. While it might be tough to take a large group here, we managed to pull it off and everyone had a great time. Whether flying solo, on a date, or with friends, definitely check this place out if you're looking for cocktails and a fun evening. The cocktails were typical cocktail price (9-12€). While I would have preferred cheaper drinks, they were absolutely worth the price.

title_review: Amazing cocktails. A must do In Madrid.
review_preview: My mum and I were staying at the Catalonia des Cortes Hotel and I was looking for a cocktail bar nearby. Luckily this place was less than 100m from the door and was the best find of the holiday. This bar is very near to...
review_full: My mum and I were staying at the Catalonia des Cortes Hotel and I was looking for a cocktail bar nearby. Luckily this place was less than 100m from the door and was the best find of the holiday. This bar is very near to the Plaza Santa Ana and we visited on a Sunday evening around 19.00. The bar isn't huge and luckily we were able to get a seat. An unassuming exterior does not prepare you for inside; quirky decor, cool music and very strong drinks. The menu was all in Spanish but we did a fairly good job of deciphering what was what. The staff were amazing; a constant stream of crisps to snack on and topping up our water glasses from a duck shaped jug. The drinks are fantastic; one of mine was called the flamingo and came in an appropriately shaped mug and was delicious. Loving the atmosphere so much we stayed for 2 drinks each- be warned, they are using the real deal spirits here and the drinks are strong. We could only manage a salad for dinner after our liquid pre- dinner drinks. We were the only tourists here and seemingly the only people who didn't know all the staff on first name terms but they were so welcoming and attentive. We were devastated that we found this place on a Sunday and could only have one visit- they are closed on Mondays. Drinks cost around €10, so about the same price you'd pay in an English city for a cocktail. You can get cheaper drinks in Madrid but I would go back to Madrid just to go here again.

review_preview: With an incredible mixture of details both large and small, from tattooed bathroom walls and luminous signs to a lovely collection of shakers at the bar, the Salmon Guru brings together different generations and gendre of people in a very eclectic ambiance.Diego Cabrera and...

Diego Cabrera and Alex Cabrera create the most delicious and visually attractive drinks. Do ask them for your favorite classic or if you are looking to be surprise just let them know what you like and they will come up with a new cocktail, Just For You. I really enjoyed their version of the Aperol Spritz, TO DIE FOR! I even had 2. My friends tried an Expresso Martini and a Pasion and their ecstasy faces said it all. I can't wait to go back.

review_preview: Had a craving for burgers and our daughter who lives in Madrid suggested Burnout on Calle Valverde since it was closer to our Airbnb (she had been to other location).  Service was very friendly, fun and prompt.  Burger was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly.  Really...
review_full: Had a craving for burgers and our daughter who lives in Madrid suggested Burnout on Calle Valverde since it was closer to our Airbnb (she had been to other location). Service was very friendly, fun and prompt. Burger was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly. Really delicious-- great quality beef w/ great flavor and fries were fresh and perfectly done, good beers and loved my choc shake. Would highly recommend.

review_preview: So delicious!!! The meat was juicy, ingredients tasty, the buns were heavenly. Just perfect! I loved the name of their guacamole+Mayo sauce: guacamayo, so smart (is a bird in Spanish)! Their bacon was crisped to perfection, fries were not so crunchy, but so so tasty....
review_full: So delicious!!! The meat was juicy, ingredients tasty, the buns were heavenly. Just perfect! I loved the name of their guacamole+Mayo sauce: guacamayo, so smart (is a bird in Spanish)! Their bacon was crisped to perfection, fries were not so crunchy, but so so tasty. The salad is also amazing, perhaps better than the fries (can't believe I just wrote that). We had a small treat of chips in the start and in the end some gummies. Just wow!
